law.catch_line: Reports of past-due loans and loans in foreclosure to early warning analyst.

text.section: Loans that are more than ninety (90) days past due shall be reported in writing by a domestic insurer to the early warning analyst created in KRS 304.2-065.
Loans in foreclosure shall be reported to the early warning analyst in writing by a domestic insurer when the foreclosure action is initiated.

law.history: Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 496, sec. 10, effective July 15, 1994.
